sense.name: electricity-controlling device
sense.commentary: A piece of equipment that controls the flow of electricity, usually turning something on or off.
sense.examples: There was a light switch on the wall. Pull the switch, you fool! I looked for hours, but I couldn't find the machine's 'on' switch.

sense.name: replacement
sense.commentary: SWITCH[+event] The substitution of one thing for another.
sense.examples: The king was replaced by a similar-looking impostor, and nobody noticed the switch. I made a switch from Folger's to Maxwell House when I realized I couldn't taste the difference. The politician's switch on abortion cost him the election. The basketball players executed a switch play to confuse the other team.

sense.name: fake hair
sense.commentary: A hairpiece used by women to give shape to a coiffure.
sense.examples: She was able to give her hair a "beehive" look without using any switches.

sense.name: railroad part
sense.commentary: The part of a rail line that puts a train onto another track.
sense.examples: We accidentally changed tracks at the switch and ended up in Canada. I worked as a switch man at the railroad station.

sense.name: implement of punishment
sense.commentary: A flexible instrument, often a tree branch, used to punish somebody.
sense.examples: Boy, go cut me a switch so I can whip you! He gave me ten lashings with a switch.
